title: (x) House M.D. logo & opening credits - Futura, Century Gothic {Brett Jordan, Aashim Tyagi, Stephen}
content:
Anyone recognize it? (Not Century Gothic, not Johnston and definitely not Gill...)

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [House M.D. Logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924092150/http:/typophile.com/files/houselogo.jpg) | 17.54 KB |
| [House opening credits](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924092150/http:/typophile.com/files/Houselowercase.png) | 199.42 KB |

 [‹ (x) Serif letters 'a' & 'm' - Delicato {Stefan H}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924092150/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41491 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Sans used in Chrysler digital interface - Corporate S {Marten F} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924092150/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41525 "Go to next forum topic")
author: twistedintellect

comments.content: The second still looks like [Century Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924092150/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/century_gothic/?sample_text=created%20by%20DAVID%20SHORE&sample_size=24) to me. Note the large x-height and goofy ’S’ and ’R’.
yep, you’re right stephen, the credits look like century gothic... still think the main title is more ’futuraey’ though... ah, those geometric sans, they’re such copy cats :-)
i guess... but i agree that main logo seems more like futura-ish.

The wayfinding in Houses hospital is done in Gill Sans. ; )

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO
